question: President Joe Biden pardoned all federal possession charges of which drug on Oct. 6?
blurb: On Oct. 6, Biden announced a three-part process aimed at reforming  the criminalization of marijuana. This process included a pardon of all prior federal offenses of simple possession. He encouraged state governors to implement similar measures and said his administration would review marijuana’s legal classification as a Schedule 1 drug, although complete decriminalization would have to be passed by Congress.

question: What was the theme of the sophomore Homecoming skit?
blurb: The Class of 2025’s Homecoming skit was based on “Jurassic Park” and featured a group of students accidentally finding and releasing a 2025-billion-year-old dinosaur in the D building basement. After starting a boxing match with the dinosaur, the sophomores realized the dinosaur was actually looking for its mother and agreed to put their differences aside to help it find its family.

question: How many days did British Prime Minister Liz Truss stay in office?
blurb: Truss announced her resignation on Oct. 20 following a 44-day term as prime minister. She entered office on Sept. 6, during the onset of an energy crisis predicted to raise energy bills by 80 percent as elevated inflation and other economic challenges contributed to an economic recession in Britain. Within weeks, her aggressive tax cutting policies drove the value of the British pound to a record low, fueled immense public backlash and plunged the economy into further turmoil.

question: Varsity Football’s senior night game’s pink out theme served to raise awareness for what?
blurb: Varsity Football’s last home game against South San Francisco High School was held on Oct. 21. The theme was “Pink Out,” with students in the bullpen dressing in pink to recognize breast cancer awareness month. After senior night celebrations, the Matadors started the game by scoring a touchdown within the first 20 seconds, but eventually lost 22-14 to SSFHS.

question: Which sports brand cut ties with Ye, formerly known as Kanye West?
blurb: German sportswear giant Adidas terminated its partnership with the rapper on Oct. 25 following his antisemitic comments. In its company statement, Adidas said, “Ye’s recent comments and actions have been unacceptable, hateful and dangerous, and they violate the company’s values of diversity and inclusion, mutual respect and fairness.”

question: Which popular Minecraft YouTuber had a face reveal on Oct. 2?
blurb: Dream, whose real name is Clay, revealed his face to 1.2 million live viewers in a five minute YouTube premiere. Before the video, he had only appeared as a smiley face to remain anonymous. However, on Oct. 2, he decided to finally show his face to allow him to post more “IRL content” to his channel with over 30 million subscribers.

question: Which driver won the 2022 Formula One World Championship?
blurb: Max Verstappen earned his second world championship title after winning the Japanese Grand Prix on Oct. 9. The 25-year-old Red Bull driver from the Netherlands broke the record for most wins in a season three weeks later after winning the Mexican Grand Prix on Oct. 30 — his 14th win of the season.

question: What team did Varsity Football defeat 42-0 in the Homecoming game?
blurb: Varsity Football destroyed Lynbrook High School 42-0 during  MVHS’s Homecoming game, by scoring a total of six touchdowns across the first, second and fourth quarters. The Homecoming Court ceremony was held at halftime along with performances from the Dance Team, Marching Band, Color Guard and Cheer.

question: Which artist’s album broke the record for the most Spotify streams in one day?
blurb: After releasing her 10th studio album, “Midnights,” at midnight on Oct. 21, singer-songwriter Taylor Swift amassed 184.6 million streams in one day, breaking the record for the most streamed album on Spotify in 24 hours. Her 13-song album dominated the Billboard chart, with Swift becoming the first artist with songs in the entire top ten of the Billboard Hot 100.

question: What Cupertino youth event featured a debate between MVHS students?
blurb: Cupertino’s youth political forum, Pizza and Politics, returned to the Cupertino City Hall on Oct. 21 for the first time since 2018. The event was coordinated by the Cupertino Youth Activity Board, Campbell Youth Commission and Saratoga Youth Commission. Along with the teen debate, the program included a mayor’s roundtable and a panel with FUHSD Board of Trustees candidates. The teen debate on California’s 2035 gas car ban featured junior Amy Zhang and senior Alex Zhang on the affirmative side and sophomores Alan Tai and Saanvi Goyal on the negation.
